decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bring them back onto the battlefield using Animate Dead. This combo strategy allows the player to cheat out expensive creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game, overwhelming their opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes disruption cards like Daze and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and manipulation spells to help find the key pieces needed to execute the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play. By combining fast mana acceleration with powerful card selection and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats early in the game. The key concept is to efficiently reanimate dangerous creatures to swing the game in your favor and disrupt your opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on the aggressive playstyle of Eldrazi creatures, utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer and It That Heralds the End to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a strong mana base and disruption spells like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a powerful battlefield presence. The inclusion of cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Glaring Fleshraker adds versatility and additional threats to keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to utilize Eldrazi creatures to deliver fast and powerful attacks while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This Reanimator combo deck aims to quickly mill key creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then use cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's strategy. By utilizing powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent, the deck can quickly close out the game before the opponent has a chance to respond. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent color availability.

The deck focuses on using Doomsday to set up a winning combo by stacking the top of the library with Thassa's Oracle as the win condition. It includes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to dig through the deck quickly, along with disruption like Force of Will and Duress to protect the combo. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to help cast Doomsday as quickly as possible. The goal is to assemble the combo and win the game in a single turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to maintain a tempo advantage by efficiently using card selection tools like Ponder and Brainstorm, while also having access to disruptive lands like Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and control the game with a mix of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on using the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. It also includes a variety of cards to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. It utilizes Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to manipulate artifacts and keep the combo intact. The deck also includes cards like Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast to counter opponent's spells. Overall, the deck aims to assemble the combo quickly and win the game with mill.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudposts and various land tutors to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul and Ulamog. It also utilizes Karn, the Great Creator to search for key artifacts like The One Ring and Planar Nexus to control the game. Disruptor Flute and Sowing Mycospawn provide additional disruption and creatures, while Glimmerpost and Glacial Chasm help gain life and stall the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with huge threats while keeping them at bay with various control elements.

The main concept of this combo Doomsday Legacy deck is to efficiently set up and execute a win condition using cards like Brainstorm, Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, Doomsday, and Thassa's Oracle to manipulate the top of your deck and win the game in a single turn. This deck relies on careful planning, resource management, and timing to pull off the combo successfully while also incorporating disruption cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using Doomsday to set up a winning combo with Thassa's Oracle. It aims to draw and manipulate cards quickly with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing countermagic with Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo. The inclusion of Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond allow for fast mana acceleration, while cards like Cabal Ritual and Dark Ritual help generate additional mana. The deck also features cards like Unearth and Street Wraith to help facilitate the win condition.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game in a single turn. The deck is built around setting up your library with the perfect sequence of cards using cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Edge of Autumn, then casting Doomsday to stack your deck with Thassa's Oracle and win the game immediately. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and discard spells like Thoughtseize to protect and enable the combo.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells like Kozilek's Command. The inclusion of cards like Once Upon a Time helps to ensure consistent draws, while cards like Eye of Ugin provide additional utility and synergy with the Eldrazi cards in the deck. Ultimately, the goal is to apply pressure early and close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain control through disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze while putting pressure on the opponent with fast creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mishra's Bauble to keep the aggression going. Additionally, there are removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats. The mana base is built to ensure consistent access to all three colors while also disrupting the opponent's resources with Wasteland.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on using efficient spells and creatures to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo. With a mix of disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure with evasive threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student adds versatility and card selection to the deck. The land base is designed to provide consistent access to the deck's colors and includes disruptive utility lands like Wasteland. Overall, this deck looks to quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and control elements.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bring them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays. Cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional versatility and card advantage. The key strategy is to efficiently reanimate big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, utilizing cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to bring back creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The deck is able to control the game with counterspells like Force of Will and removal spells like Fatal Push, while also having card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also includes utility creatures like Troll of Khazad-dÃ»m and Psychic Frog to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.
